title: Firefighters perish in Spain and Portugal wildfires as neighboring countries send aid
subhead: Wildfires have ravaged more than 450,000 hectares of land across the Iberian peninsula since the start of the year, setting records in a region particularly hard hit by intensive heatwaves and drought affecting southern Europe.

title: Buffeted by Trump, India seeks to strengthen ties with Russia and China
subhead: Threatened by Washington with 50% tariffs, India, under Prime Minister Narendra Modi, has responded by turning to its powerful neighbors. The Indian foreign minister is set to visit Russia soon, while the Chinese foreign minister is expected in New Delhi on Monday.
byline: By Sophie Landrin (New Delhi, India, correspondent)

title: 'It is Jesus who speaks through me': The enigmatic life of Marthe Robin
subhead: 'Marthe Robin, Saint Or Fraud?' (1/5). In the 1920s, a paralyzed and bedridden farmer's daughter became a Catholic mystic known for her supernatural visions, and crowds flocked to see her until she died in 1981.

title: AI, my students and me: 'Last semester marks the nadir of my experience in academia'
subhead: 'Letters from America' (1/6). The writer and journalist Thomas Chatterton Williams has been startled by the omnipresence of artificial intelligence at university, which he believes threatens the very foundations of education and our ability to think.

title: After Anchorage summit, Europeans stand firmly behind Zelensky in the face of Trump
subhead: Several leaders from across Europe are set to travel to Washington on Monday with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky to meet with the American president. The Ukrainian crisis now pits Kyiv and the main European governments against Moscow and Washington.

title: Henri Matisse and his heirs: The end of a financial windfall
subhead: Since Henri Matisse's death in 1954, four generations of his family have guarded his vast body of work jealously and with the utmost discretion. But when the painter's work entered the public domain in January, it ended the lucrative reproduction rights the heirs had enjoyed, as well as their oversight of everything concerning their ancestor.
byline: By Roxana Azimi and Clément Ghys

title: China's robotics industry surges amid promise of a $5 trillion market
subhead: From a global conference to robotic games inside the National Stadium, Beijing becomes the world capital of robots from August 8 to 17. The event showcases China's extraordinary acceleration in this sector – from automated industrial arms to AI-powered humanoids.
byline: By Vincent Fagot and Jordan Pouille (Beijing (China), correspondent)
